conclusion: Understanding the problem setup with basketball dropped from height H, rebounds to height h, air resistance magnitude is lambda times gravitational force, and need to find velocity ratio.
Set up equations for motion defining v1 as velocity before collision and v2 as velocity after collision with alpha as velocity ratio.
Analyze downward motion with net force mg(1-lambda) and use work-energy theorem to find v1 = sqrt(2g(1-lambda)H).
Analyze upward motion with net force -mg(1+lambda) and use work-energy theorem to find v2 = sqrt(2g(1+lambda)h).
Use constraint on lambda where 0<lambda<(H-h)/(H+h) to verify physical sense of alpha expression.
Simplify expression for alpha and interpret as coefficient of restitution with alpha^2 = ((1+lambda)h/(1-lambda)H).
Determine final answer for velocity ratio as alpha = sqrt((1+lambda)h/(1-lambda)H).
